artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Takabatake Ransen; Publisher: Akiyama Buemon; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 463; Marks, Genji's World in Japanese Woodblock Prints (2012), p. 154 no. 146, G084; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 128, p. 291.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; demon-faced figure at right, with green skin and yellow horns, wearing a bold patterned garment in red, yellow, green and purple with large yellow tie at waist, and wearing white tabi socks; seated couple at center with woman, wearing white kimono with dark and light blue fan-like pattern with brown foliage, leaning into man wearing purple and white checked kimono; frowning man wearing brown and blue peering around a screen depicting demons around a large cauldron; moon in ULC
dimension: 14 1/2 × 10 in. (36.83 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 彫工野口円治 {horikō Noguchi Enkatsu}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Text by Tentendō Shujin after Ryūtei Tanehiko.
title: A Rustic Genji by a Fraudulent Murasaki
